result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defense has received discovery and is waiting for an offer.
State will route the file to have an offer prepared.
Hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on August 15, 2022

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key with the exception of incidental contact.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

2:08 PM Defendant Zion J Hodges in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
